====================================
#WINDOWS - for static Libraries
====================================
 1. Use 7Zip to unpack and unzip tar file googletest-release-X.Y.Z.tar.gz
 2. Open command prompt
 3.	cd path\to\googletest-release-X.Y.Z
 4.	mkdir winbuild
 5.	cd winbuild
 6.	cmake .. -AWin32

 7. do not close the command prompt but open the just created winbuild\googletest-distribution.sln in visual studio
 8. open properties on gtest, gmock, gtest_main, and gmock_main and make sure C/C++ - Code Generation - Runtime Library #   is set to /MTd for Debug and /MT for RelWithDebInfo
 9. set configuration to Debug
10. build all
11. set configuration to Release
12. build all
13. From the same command prompt from above, copy files to third party prebuilt library directories:
	copy lib\Debug\*.lib %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\lib\WinHost\Win32\Debug
	copy lib\RelWithDebInfo\*.lib %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\lib\WinHost\Win32\Debug

14. cd ..
15. copy the include files
   copy googletest\install\gtest to %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\GoogleTest\include
   copy googlemock\install\gmock to %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\GoogleTest\include

    NOTE:  if there is no install directory under winbuild, you may need to rebuild the INSTALL project

To build for x64, repeat the above steps but replace steps 6 and 13 with the following steps
 6.	cmake ..\cmake -Dprotobuf_BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=install -Dprotobuf_BUILD_TESTS=OFF
13. From the same command prompt from above, copy files to third party prebuilt library directories:
	copy lib\Debug\*.lib %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\lib\WinHost\x64\Debug
	copy lib\RelWithDebInfo\*.lib %COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME%\lib\WinHost\x64\Release
